alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 9:43PM CDT until July 04 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following county, Morris. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Council Grove, White City, Wilsey, Parkerville and Council Grove Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
